sections.PURPOSE: Kronos Troop Platoon Leadership are familiarized and qualified in the use of live Claymores.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Trainees successful conduct three dummy claymores on 05JAN
Trainees successful conduct a blank claymore iteration in the morning and a live claymore iteration in the afternoon on 08JAN
sections.END STATE:
All Kronos Troop PLs, SLs, and ten selected TLs successful detonate a live claymore and are qualified in its use.
Training Objectives:
Trainees receive instruction on the proper use of the Claymore
Trainees conduct three dummy claymore iterations prior to going to the Range
Trainees successful complete a blank claymore iteration under supervision from the instructors Trainees successful denotate a live claymore
Resourcing
CLI: A-M-M Rations Cycle
CLIII: N/A
CLIV: N/A
CLV: 25 live Claymores, 25 blank Claymores
CLVIII: K33, with 3rd PLT Medic Misc: 2x 10lb Fire extinguishers (provided by Troop)
Back Side Support
Instructors/Safeties: SFC Pelletier, SSG Ozeta, SSG Colvin Ammo Point: x1 NCO
Gate Guard: x2 Soldiers with radio
sections.MISSION: K TRP, 3/2CR conducts a Claymore Range for Platoon Leaders, Squad Leaders, and Team Leaders at DEMO 1 on 08 JAN 2024. This range will familiarize Platoon Leadership on the use of the M18A1 Claymore and prepare Squads to use the M18A1 Claymore during Squad Live Fire in March.

draw.mission_task_and_description: Killer Troop conducts a claymore range at Demo 1 on 10 October 2024.

values: Convoy Leaders will give ramp brief prior to movement.
Vehicle Crews will wear all required PPE while operating tactical vehicles.
Vehicles will follow range roads and use ground guides in parking areas.
Ramp Brief, Proper PPE, Ground Guides, Follow Roads
Vehicle Crews, Convoy Leaders, Training Leadership
Ammo will not be placed on the ground, will be covered with fire retardant tarps, and separated by DODIC.
Adequate guards will be provided for ammo.
All ammo handling procedures will be followed for transport, storage, and distribution.
Range Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs, Ammo NCOIC
Safeties check for hearing protection, to ensure Troopers have standard issue protection or they will be provided hearing protection prior to firing weapon.
PCCs/PCIs Safety Brief
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Firers will wear approved ballistic eye wear while at the range to prevent expelled dirt, dust, and debris from damaging their eyes.
Firers will wear Helmet and Body Armor while down range for additional protection.
PCC/PCIs, Lane Safeties, Safety Brief
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Brief range limits and cease fire procedures; movement downrange will be controlled by the range safeties.
Range safeties will ensure that no SMs are downrange of live Claymores prior to the setup and detonation of a Live Claymore.
Safety brief
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs, Lane Safeties
SM's will conduct numerous iterations on a Dummy Claymore with instructor validation prior to detonating a live Claymore.
Instructor will stop SM during the live Claymore iteration for any Safety Violations.
Safety Brief, Dummy Claymore Training, Blank Claymore certification iteration, Instructor observation
OIC/NCOIC, RSO, Instructors, Leaders
Range will cease fire with severe weather that would impact live Claymore detonation.
Range OIC will contact GTA range operations desk if the weather is called into question.
Safety Brief
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
SMs will be instructed to not interact with local wildlife.
Range OIC/NCOIC, RSO, Instructors, or SMs will call a halt to training if local wildlife is present in detonation zone.
Safety Brief, Observation of detonation zone
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The OIC, RSO, and range leadership will conduct a range safety brief prior to all live fire training. The OIC and RSO are overall responsible for safety. However, safeties and instructors have the responsibility to be actively engaged in range activities and soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event. Safety briefs and inspections will also ensure all other mentioned risks are properly mitigated. At least one vehicle and medic will be on site in the unlikely event of any serious injuries.
